programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: Investigator Jack Reacher leaps off the pages of Lee Child's novel and onto the big screen in this thriller. When a horrible crime is committed, all evidence points to the suspect in custody, who offers up a single note in defense: "Get Jack Reacher!"

programme.title: Accident Man
programme.desc: Mike is a tough hitman, who makes his hits look like accidents or suicide. He's in a gang of hitmen, each with his own style. When his loved ex is killed, Mike looks for those responsible.

programme.title: Armored
programme.desc: A crew of officers at an armored transport security firm embark on the ultimate heist – against their own company. The seemingly fool-proof plan soon proves to be useless when an unexpected witness interferes, as the plan quickly unravels.

programme.title: Stealth
programme.desc: From the director of XXX and The Fast and The Furious comes an exhilarating epic blockbuster starring Josh Lucas, Jessica Biel and Academy Award® Winner Jamie Foxx (Best Actor, RAY, 2004). rated -PG-13

programme.title: The Art of War
programme.desc: UN's secretary general uses covert operations to help diplomacy along. Shaw's called back 6 months after one such operation. He witnesses the murder of Chinese UN ambassador at UN, NYC, chases the assassin and ends up a suspect.

programme.title: The Art of War II: Betrayal
programme.desc: Agent Neil Shaw returns in the no holds barred action adventure sequel. When Shaw is called out of retirement as a Hollywood film consultant by the murder of his long-time martial arts mentor, 'Mother.'

programme.title: The Art of War III: Retribution
programme.desc: When international diplomacy comes up short, extreme measures must be taken. In the newest installment of Art of War, Agent Neil Shaw is on a covert mission to stop North Korean terrorists from obtaining a nuclear bomb.

programme.title: The Professional
programme.desc: The mysterious Leon (Jean Reno) is New York's top hitman. When his next-door neighbors are murdered, Leon becomes the unwilling guardian of the family's sole survivor - 12-year-old Mathilda (Natalie Portman). Rating:R

programme.title: Solar System: The Secrets of the Universe
programme.desc: Join our host on the International Space Station of the year 2050. Marvel at the three-dimensional sights and learn many things about the astral bodies that surround us.

programme.title: Science of the Soul
programme.desc: Do human beings have souls? From the beginning of human awareness – no matter the context and no matter the age – the answer was always \"yes\". All cultures have universally argued that human beings are \"ensouled\".

programme.title: Einstein's Universe
programme.desc: A fascinating exploration of Einstein's theory of relativity told by narrator actor Peter Ustinov, and a cadre of preeminent scientists. Produced on the centennial of Einstein’s birth in 1979 by WGBH and BBC, based on Nigel Calder’s titular book.

programme.title: Into the Cosmos: The Space Race, Mars and Beyond
programme.desc: Detailed accounts of previous missions for the exploration of Mars, including the landing of the rovers on the planets surface.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers
programme.desc: The Burj Dubai holds the title as the tallest man-made structure ever built, pushing the technological envelope. Near India's capital Delhi, the Qutub Minar reigns supreme for almost a thousand years as the world's tallest brick minaret.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers
programme.desc: On an island the size of Singapore, water scarcity is a dire issue. The solution is the construction of an urban reservoir, the first of its kind in the world. Together with cutting-edge technology, Singapore is on its way to water sufficiency.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 3
programme.desc: Tankers are the workhorses of our modern economy and the largest of these are built in Korea. Features like double-hulls and multiple tanks have pushed the cargo and safety capacity of tankers to new heights, making them the mainstay of the oil industry.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 4
programme.desc: For years, the roads of Mumbai were a hotbed of congestion and overcrowding. Now, a dynamic link road promises to ease the city's traffic woes, but the construction of Mumbai's first double-tiered flyover has been anything but easy.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 5
programme.desc: The largest airport terminal in the world in Beijing is an engineering marvel that nonetheless pays strict adherence to the principles of Chinese Feng shui, and marks a new footnote in an age-old tradition of building big.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 6
programme.desc: It is the world's deepest immersed Tunnel, the Marmaray Project promises to ease Istanbul's decades-old traffic woes. Located in an earthquake zone, it is an engineering feat that is only rivaled by the discovery of a nearby ancient port.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 7
programme.desc: Self-declared 8th Wonder of the World, the Palm trilogy is the largest man-made island chain in the world. Employing technology like satellite positioning, the Palm trilogy has broken new records and engineering milestones.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: From living in caves to grand mansions, shelter has always been high on the list of priorities.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Examining the history of the Great Wall of China.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Without water, civilization is simply not possible; Romans took control of their water seriously.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: How gold is mined and transformed into everyday objects like jewelry and currency.

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: The earth is 4.5 billion years old and it is slowly dying. Tectonic activity is slowly cooling the planet – the continents will eventually move together to form a new supercontinent called Pangea Ultima.

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: Naked Science investigates the violent cosmological forces that create planets and discover what it is that makes a planet a planet.

programme.title: The First Wives Club
programme.desc: Join the Club - The First Wives Club, the good-time battle-of-the-sexes satire sparked by snappy one-liners, great physical-comedy gags and three unforgettable stars in top form, Bette Midler, Goldie Hawn and Diane Keaton.

programme.title: Wayne's World
programme.desc: When a sleazy TV exec offers Wayne and Garth a contract to tape their late-night cable-access show at his network, they discover the road to the big time is full of gnarly twists and turns.

programme.title: Wayne's World 2
programme.desc: Having achieved godlike status as a late-night TV personality, Wayne (Mike Myers) now confronts the question that has plagued man for centuries: Is there life after cable?

programme.title: Nacho Libre
programme.desc: Jack Black is more hilarious than ever as Ignacio, a monastery cook who feeds orphan children by day and by night transforms himself into Nacho Libre, a notorious Luchador in stretchy pants.

programme.desc: The front door is stripped of paint. The HVAC system is connected and tested. Floating shelves are installed. The brick steps are repaired. An herb garden is planted, and the custom wallpaper is hung.

programme.desc: The 1890s Victorian house in Atlanta once owned by South Atlanta's first black postmaster was a dilapidated and abandoned structure. Now, it has been restored and the crew is back for a tour.

programme.title: Naked Gun 33 1/3: The Final Insult
programme.desc: Oscar® night. Will someone please kick that numbskull off-stage? Wait! That’s no ordinary numbskull. That’s Lt. Frank Drebin, crashing the ceremonies to stop a terrorist plot!

programme.title: Gladiator
programme.desc: A man robbed of his name and his dignity strives to win them back, and gain the freedom of his people, in this epic historical drama from director Ridley Scott.

programme.title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
programme.desc: Grossing the highest box-office of any British film in the US when released in 1975, this "cult classic" comedy from the Monty Python team loosely follows the legend of King Arthur, along with his squire and his Knights of the Round Table.

programme.title: The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!
programme.desc: Leslie Nielsen stars as Police Squad's own granite-jawed, rockbrained cop Frank Drebin, who bumbles across a mind control scheme to assassinate Queen Elizabeth.

programme.title: The Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear
programme.desc: Lt. Frank Drebin (Leslie Nielsen) loves a mystery. Why are we here? Is there life after sex? Yes, Drebin tackles the big issues— and the biggest of all is how to stop devious Quentin Hapsburg’s (Robert Goulet) plan to destroy the environment!

programme.title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
programme.desc: The non-human machine ruling elite of the nuclear war-torn future has dispatched a cyborg assassin into the past to kill a young boy because he soon will be the resistance leader against the machines.

programme.title: Terminator Genisys
programme.desc: When John Connor sends Kyle Reese back to 1984 to protect a young Sarah Connor, unexpected events alter the past and threaten the future for all mankind. Charged with a new mission, Reese must join forces with Sarah and her "Guardian" to save the world.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: An eclectic collection of homemade robots including Glitterbomb, designed by nine-year-old April, which comes complete with a huge pink axe. A team of students from Falkirk bring a robot made of wood with a petrol engine.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Former holiday camp bluecoats enter the competition with their `launcher' Apollo. Father and-son-team Kan-Opener have a robot with huge piercing claws. A team of engineering students have created a future tech machine called Sweeney Todd.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Featuring one of the most bizarre, but certainly the tallest robot ever seen on `Robot Wars', Gabriel, built by Mensa member Craig and his three sons. It has wheels as tall as a washing machine and a huge samurai sword.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Winner robots from rounds one through five battle it out in the arena, a wild card from the runners up throws a spanner in the works as it tries to overthrow attempts at glory.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: A new spinner has something to prove and a family team pour blood, sweat and tears into keeping their robot wars dream alive. The robots compete through brutal group battles and fierce head to heads for a place in the heat final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The challenge for competitors is even tougher as the infamous House Robots have been let off the leash in a new twist. This is the second heat, and only one of the eight teams can go through to the series grand final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Four teams progress into a mini league going head to head in a bid for points. The top two teams will face each other in the heat final for the chance to secure their place in this series' grand final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: This fourth heat is an explosive display of spinners as old favourites take on new hopefuls. They must dodge the arena hazards and the menacing new twist as house robots are unleashed to attack competitors and inflict maximum damage.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The reigning champions Apollo mount their defence of the title. They face stiff competition from Ms Nightshade, Coyote, Rusty, Crackers'N'Smash, Meggamouse, Trolley Rage and Carbide.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: It is the grand final and the teams must dodge the arena hazards and, in a menacing new twist, they can also hit the Arena Tyre to unleash the dreaded House Robots, allowing them to inflict maximum damage anywhere in the arena.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The teams are Donald Thump, Behemoth, Sabretooth, Apollo, Apocalypse and The Swarm. Along the way they must dodge arena hazards, menacing house robots and the all-new Fog of War.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Returning champions Carbide mount their title defence against some of the toughest machines in the competition. They will have to fight through brutal group battles and nightmarish knockout rounds to make it to the heat final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Competing in this heat are: Apex, Vulture, Terrorhurtz, Track-Tion, Bucky the Robot and Rapid. The battles are all overseen by judges Professor Noel Sharkey, Professor Sethu Vijayakumar and Dr Lucy Rogers.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The fourth heat features an experienced roboteer fighting to secure his legacy, a new wave spinner and a powerful crusher. Competing through group battles for a place in the final are Iron-Awe 6, The Kegs, Tauron, Nuts 2, Concussion and Androne 4000.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Bearnaise sauce; Kansas City barbecue sauce; tartar sauce with capers, shallots and cornichons; cocktail sauce; salsa verde.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Porchetta, a highly seasoned roasted pork; glazed ham; pork and plums.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Scalloped potatoes; potato salad; pureed potatoes; smashed potatoes.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha visits the incredible Orchid Show at the New York Botanical Garden; this year's show immerses you in a mesmerizing array of orchids designed by acclaimed artist Lily Kwong.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Now with over 200 chickens and 20 different breeds, Martha shares her vast knowledge about raising and caring for her flock; learn the how-tos of building a coop.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha builds a brand new, half-acre raised bed vegetable garden on her farm! It's a step-by-step guide to designing, building, preparing the soil, and planting.
programme.sub-title: Martha Builds a Raised Bed Vegetable Garden

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Everything is coming up roses on Martha's Bedford farm; Martha is creating a brand new rose garden with almost 200 roses; from color to fragrance, the inspired world of roses is a very good thing.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha's azalea grove is bursting with the last flowers of spring; then everything you need to know about hostas; Martha takes up bird watching.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha journeys through her local area in search of the ultimate fresh-baked croissants and sourdough bread; learning about homemade bread and pastries.
programme.sub-title: How to Make Croissants and Sourdough Bread

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha is in the test kitchen with English chef, restaurateur, and author Jamie Oliver, and they're cooking up a mouth-watering menu of dishes that are easy to make.
programme.sub-title: One Pot Wonders With Jamie Oliver

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha and her niece Sophie visit their favorite tea shop, Arogya, in Westport, Conn., to discover the do's and don'ts of making tea; they return to Martha's kitchen to create dishes with tea.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha visits Mast Market in Mt. Kisco, N.Y., and learns the art behind making their renowned chocolate; from roasting cacao, to stone grinding, to forming delicious bars and chips.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha shares techniques for making the perfect burgers; Pat LaFrieda joins Martha to grind his beef mix; Thomas Joseph joins to make a hake fish burger and Martha shares her turkey burger.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Hannah Heimbuch and Martha demonstrate how to prepare fish for cooking; Chef Marcus Samuelsson makes cured king salmon and halibut en papillote; Martha breaks down a Dungeness crab.
programme.sub-title: Today's Catch: Fish Recipes for Everyday

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Bike tours; West Dean Estate and Gardens; rhubarb crisp; fritillaria; bull mastiffs; bike glossary.

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Herb brushes; Fiestaware; tree expert Charlie Marder; grilled Cornish game hens.
programme.sub-title: Herb Brushes; Fiesta Ware; Tree Pruning; Grilling With Herbs

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Blueberry pie; felt rounds for dishes; sandblasting; tool kit.
programme.sub-title: Making Pie; Felt Rounds; Sandblasting; Tool Kit; Bird House

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Wreaths; pots and pans; maintaining garden tools; flavoring oils.
programme.sub-title: Flavored Oils; Oiling Rusty Tools; Choosing Pots and Pans

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Ribbon rosettes; garden cake; sectioning grapefruit; stocking a pantry.
programme.sub-title: Ribbons and Bows; Garden Cake; Grapefruit; Pantry Organizing

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha visits her former home, Turkey Hill, where everything began for Martha in the 1970s; then back to her Bedford farm for a garden club tour - a peek inside Martha's gardens past and present.
programme.sub-title: Martha's Garden Tours of Turkey Hill and Bedford

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha's new passion project is the maze she's building on her Bedford farm; she shares her plans and inspiration for the project and teaches the proper measuring, staking and fertilizing techniques to properly plant successful trees.
programme.sub-title: Martha's Amazing Maze and How to Grow Trees From Seedlings

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha shows how to properly move an established tree on her very own Christmas tree farm; she gives a tour of her pinetum where she teaches about new and unusual conifer trees.
programme.sub-title: Everything You Need To Know About Conifers

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha brings the outdoors inside the home and shares her love of houseplants; she shows how to take care of the most popular houseplants and how to propagate them to create new plants.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha explores how to care for succulents including watering, fertilizing, and repotting.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha takes us inside her vegetable greenhouse to see how she has turned her harvest into a year-round bounty; she collects, stores, and sows seeds, and makes her perfect green drink.
programme.sub-title: Inside Martha's Vegetable Greenhouse; Seed Starting

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Restaurant owners Angie Rito and Scott Tacinelli join Martha in making their rolled lasagna with San Marzano tomato sauce, Italian bolognese, and chrysanthemum Caesar salad.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha, Monica Tran Carden, and Andrew Yu make homemade dumplings; Martha and Monica hand-make wontons and pork dumplings; Andrew and Martha prepare jade dumplings and pork and shrimp dumplings.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha samples bagel toppings and is joined by Gary Greengrass, owner of Barney Greengrass, an NYC staple; at PopUp Bagels, Martha makes bagels and constructs breakfast sandwiches with Adam Goldberg.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha makes the classic meringue cake from Casa Cipriani with pastry chef Alessia Tomassetti; Martha and bakery owner Lucie Franc De Ferriere bake a pear raspberry cake with jam and maple buttercream.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha and Chef Daniel Humm make redefined vegan dishes; Martha and Chef Daniel make a refreshing cocktail and gazpacho, followed by mushroom and seaweed baked rice and a rhubarb cobbler for dessert.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha and Chef Costas Spiliadis of Estiatorio Milos make Taramosalata and salad; they build an eggplant and zucchini tower with tzatziki; then, they salt-bake a fish served with yogurt.

programme.title: Essence of Emeril
programme.desc: Avocado soup; baked eggs and avocados; grapefruit and avocados; avocado stuffed with chicken salad.

programme.title: Essence of Emeril
programme.desc: Roux; rabbit and wild mushroom gumbo; seafood gumbo.

programme.title: Essence of Emeril
programme.desc: Mushroom and ham kabobs with rosemary aioli; portobello kabob; andouille and chicken kabobs with creole mustard; grilled shrimp kabobs with jalapeno butter.

programme.title: Emeril Live
programme.desc: Dandelion and bitter greens with warm bacon dressing; Pennsylvania Dutch corn chowder; ham and apple dump.

programme.title: Emeril Live
programme.desc: Mussel soup; coquilles St. Jacques; stuffed devil crabs; linguine with clam sauce.

programme.title: Emeril Live
programme.desc: Vermicelli with citrus cream sauce and radicchio; fettucine pieces with zucchini and clams; wild mushroom bolognese; super stuffed shells.

programme.title: Emeril Live

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: Investigator Jack Reacher leaps off the pages of Lee Child's novel and onto the big screen in this thriller. When a horrible crime is committed, all evidence points to the suspect in custody, who offers up a single note in defense: "Get Jack Reacher!"

programme.title: Accident Man
programme.desc: Mike is a tough hitman, who makes his hits look like accidents or suicide. He's in a gang of hitmen, each with his own style. When his loved ex is killed, Mike looks for those responsible.

programme.title: Armored
programme.desc: A crew of officers at an armored transport security firm embark on the ultimate heist – against their own company. The seemingly fool-proof plan soon proves to be useless when an unexpected witness interferes, as the plan quickly unravels.

programme.title: Stealth
programme.desc: From the director of XXX and The Fast and The Furious comes an exhilarating epic blockbuster starring Josh Lucas, Jessica Biel and Academy Award® Winner Jamie Foxx (Best Actor, RAY, 2004). rated -PG-13

programme.title: The Art of War
programme.desc: UN's secretary general uses covert operations to help diplomacy along. Shaw's called back 6 months after one such operation. He witnesses the murder of Chinese UN ambassador at UN, NYC, chases the assassin and ends up a suspect.

programme.title: The Art of War II: Betrayal
programme.desc: Agent Neil Shaw returns in the no holds barred action adventure sequel. When Shaw is called out of retirement as a Hollywood film consultant by the murder of his long-time martial arts mentor, 'Mother.'

programme.title: The Art of War III: Retribution
programme.desc: When international diplomacy comes up short, extreme measures must be taken. In the newest installment of Art of War, Agent Neil Shaw is on a covert mission to stop North Korean terrorists from obtaining a nuclear bomb.

programme.title: The Professional
programme.desc: The mysterious Leon (Jean Reno) is New York's top hitman. When his next-door neighbors are murdered, Leon becomes the unwilling guardian of the family's sole survivor - 12-year-old Mathilda (Natalie Portman). Rating:R

programme.title: Solar System: The Secrets of the Universe
programme.desc: Join our host on the International Space Station of the year 2050. Marvel at the three-dimensional sights and learn many things about the astral bodies that surround us.

programme.title: Science of the Soul
programme.desc: Do human beings have souls? From the beginning of human awareness – no matter the context and no matter the age – the answer was always \"yes\". All cultures have universally argued that human beings are \"ensouled\".

programme.title: Einstein's Universe
programme.desc: A fascinating exploration of Einstein's theory of relativity told by narrator actor Peter Ustinov, and a cadre of preeminent scientists. Produced on the centennial of Einstein’s birth in 1979 by WGBH and BBC, based on Nigel Calder’s titular book.

programme.title: Into the Cosmos: The Space Race, Mars and Beyond
programme.desc: Detailed accounts of previous missions for the exploration of Mars, including the landing of the rovers on the planets surface.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers
programme.desc: The Burj Dubai holds the title as the tallest man-made structure ever built, pushing the technological envelope. Near India's capital Delhi, the Qutub Minar reigns supreme for almost a thousand years as the world's tallest brick minaret.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers
programme.desc: On an island the size of Singapore, water scarcity is a dire issue. The solution is the construction of an urban reservoir, the first of its kind in the world. Together with cutting-edge technology, Singapore is on its way to water sufficiency.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 3
programme.desc: Tankers are the workhorses of our modern economy and the largest of these are built in Korea. Features like double-hulls and multiple tanks have pushed the cargo and safety capacity of tankers to new heights, making them the mainstay of the oil industry.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 4
programme.desc: For years, the roads of Mumbai were a hotbed of congestion and overcrowding. Now, a dynamic link road promises to ease the city's traffic woes, but the construction of Mumbai's first double-tiered flyover has been anything but easy.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 5
programme.desc: The largest airport terminal in the world in Beijing is an engineering marvel that nonetheless pays strict adherence to the principles of Chinese Feng shui, and marks a new footnote in an age-old tradition of building big.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 6
programme.desc: It is the world's deepest immersed Tunnel, the Marmaray Project promises to ease Istanbul's decades-old traffic woes. Located in an earthquake zone, it is an engineering feat that is only rivaled by the discovery of a nearby ancient port.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 7
programme.desc: Self-declared 8th Wonder of the World, the Palm trilogy is the largest man-made island chain in the world. Employing technology like satellite positioning, the Palm trilogy has broken new records and engineering milestones.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: From living in caves to grand mansions, shelter has always been high on the list of priorities.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Examining the history of the Great Wall of China.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Without water, civilization is simply not possible; Romans took control of their water seriously.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: How gold is mined and transformed into everyday objects like jewelry and currency.

programme.title: Naked Science

programme.title: This Old House

programme.title: This Old House

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: A Yorkshire terrier who became aggressive after going blind; a spoiled Pekingese/miniature poodle mix; a Rottweiler with a dangerous obsession with the horses on the ranch where she lives.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: A Lab-greyhound mix has aggression problems; a Rhodesian Ridgeback-boxer mix has severe dog aggression.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: A Yorkshire terrier barks too much; a once-shy German shepherd becomes aggressive; a shepherd mix has a whining problem.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: Cesar tries to help an aggressive Shiba Inu from Japan and meets a wire fox terrier who has a fixation with a riding lawn-mower.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: Cesar revisits some of his toughest cases and sees how being on the show changed not only the dogs, but the lives of the owners.

programme.desc: Unlock the vital role these feared hunters and spinners play in Earth's ecology.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Kangaroo

programme.title: Wild Birds of Australia

programme.title: The egg: Bursting into life

programme.title: Parents In The Wild

programme.title: Chasing the Rains
programme.desc: In Samburu, matriarch Anastasia turns her elephant herd north after a local river dries up; cheetah mom Kuleta evades a crafty pack of hyenas in Naboisho; checking in on wild dog Phoenix and her new litter in Laikipia.

programme.title: Chasing the Rains
programme.desc: How elephants dig wells; a sudden river-filling downpour; cheetah Kuleta loses one of her cubs to lions; wild dog Phoenix faces off with a hyena mob.

programme.title: African Bambi

programme.title: How the Wild Things Sleep

programme.title: Islands: Nature's Wild Laboratories

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: An eclectic collection of homemade robots including Glitterbomb, designed by nine-year-old April, which comes complete with a huge pink axe. A team of students from Falkirk bring a robot made of wood with a petrol engine.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Former holiday camp bluecoats enter the competition with their `launcher' Apollo. Father and-son-team Kan-Opener have a robot with huge piercing claws. A team of engineering students have created a future tech machine called Sweeney Todd.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Featuring one of the most bizarre, but certainly the tallest robot ever seen on `Robot Wars', Gabriel, built by Mensa member Craig and his three sons. It has wheels as tall as a washing machine and a huge samurai sword.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Winner robots from rounds one through five battle it out in the arena, a wild card from the runners up throws a spanner in the works as it tries to overthrow attempts at glory.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: A new spinner has something to prove and a family team pour blood, sweat and tears into keeping their robot wars dream alive. The robots compete through brutal group battles and fierce head to heads for a place in the heat final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The challenge for competitors is even tougher as the infamous House Robots have been let off the leash in a new twist. This is the second heat, and only one of the eight teams can go through to the series grand final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Four teams progress into a mini league going head to head in a bid for points. The top two teams will face each other in the heat final for the chance to secure their place in this series' grand final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: This fourth heat is an explosive display of spinners as old favourites take on new hopefuls. They must dodge the arena hazards and the menacing new twist as house robots are unleashed to attack competitors and inflict maximum damage.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The reigning champions Apollo mount their defence of the title. They face stiff competition from Ms Nightshade, Coyote, Rusty, Crackers'N'Smash, Meggamouse, Trolley Rage and Carbide.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: It is the grand final and the teams must dodge the arena hazards and, in a menacing new twist, they can also hit the Arena Tyre to unleash the dreaded House Robots, allowing them to inflict maximum damage anywhere in the arena.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The teams are Donald Thump, Behemoth, Sabretooth, Apollo, Apocalypse and The Swarm. Along the way they must dodge arena hazards, menacing house robots and the all-new Fog of War.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Returning champions Carbide mount their title defence against some of the toughest machines in the competition. They will have to fight through brutal group battles and nightmarish knockout rounds to make it to the heat final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Competing in this heat are: Apex, Vulture, Terrorhurtz, Track-Tion, Bucky the Robot and Rapid. The battles are all overseen by judges Professor Noel Sharkey, Professor Sethu Vijayakumar and Dr Lucy Rogers.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The fourth heat features an experienced roboteer fighting to secure his legacy, a new wave spinner and a powerful crusher. Competing through group battles for a place in the final are Iron-Awe 6, The Kegs, Tauron, Nuts 2, Concussion and Androne 4000.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Bearnaise sauce; Kansas City barbecue sauce; tartar sauce with capers, shallots and cornichons; cocktail sauce; salsa verde.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Porchetta, a highly seasoned roasted pork; glazed ham; pork and plums.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Scalloped potatoes; potato salad; pureed potatoes; smashed potatoes.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha visits the incredible Orchid Show at the New York Botanical Garden; this year's show immerses you in a mesmerizing array of orchids designed by acclaimed artist Lily Kwong.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Now with over 200 chickens and 20 different breeds, Martha shares her vast knowledge about raising and caring for her flock; learn the how-tos of building a coop.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha builds a brand new, half-acre raised bed vegetable garden on her farm! It's a step-by-step guide to designing, building, preparing the soil, and planting.
programme.sub-title: Martha Builds a Raised Bed Vegetable Garden

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Everything is coming up roses on Martha's Bedford farm; Martha is creating a brand new rose garden with almost 200 roses; from color to fragrance, the inspired world of roses is a very good thing.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha's azalea grove is bursting with the last flowers of spring; then everything you need to know about hostas; Martha takes up bird watching.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha journeys through her local area in search of the ultimate fresh-baked croissants and sourdough bread; learning about homemade bread and pastries.
programme.sub-title: How to Make Croissants and Sourdough Bread

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha is in the test kitchen with English chef, restaurateur, and author Jamie Oliver, and they're cooking up a mouth-watering menu of dishes that are easy to make.
programme.sub-title: One Pot Wonders With Jamie Oliver

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha and her niece Sophie visit their favorite tea shop, Arogya, in Westport, Conn., to discover the do's and don'ts of making tea; they return to Martha's kitchen to create dishes with tea.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha visits Mast Market in Mt. Kisco, N.Y., and learns the art behind making their renowned chocolate; from roasting cacao, to stone grinding, to forming delicious bars and chips.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha shares techniques for making the perfect burgers; Pat LaFrieda joins Martha to grind his beef mix; Thomas Joseph joins to make a hake fish burger and Martha shares her turkey burger.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Hannah Heimbuch and Martha demonstrate how to prepare fish for cooking; Chef Marcus Samuelsson makes cured king salmon and halibut en papillote; Martha breaks down a Dungeness crab.
programme.sub-title: Today's Catch: Fish Recipes for Everyday

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Bike tours; West Dean Estate and Gardens; rhubarb crisp; fritillaria; bull mastiffs; bike glossary.

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Herb brushes; Fiestaware; tree expert Charlie Marder; grilled Cornish game hens.
programme.sub-title: Herb Brushes; Fiesta Ware; Tree Pruning; Grilling With Herbs

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Blueberry pie; felt rounds for dishes; sandblasting; tool kit.
programme.sub-title: Making Pie; Felt Rounds; Sandblasting; Tool Kit; Bird House

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Wreaths; pots and pans; maintaining garden tools; flavoring oils.
programme.sub-title: Flavored Oils; Oiling Rusty Tools; Choosing Pots and Pans

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Ribbon rosettes; garden cake; sectioning grapefruit; stocking a pantry.
programme.sub-title: Ribbons and Bows; Garden Cake; Grapefruit; Pantry Organizing

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha visits her former home, Turkey Hill, where everything began for Martha in the 1970s; then back to her Bedford farm for a garden club tour - a peek inside Martha's gardens past and present.
programme.sub-title: Martha's Garden Tours of Turkey Hill and Bedford

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha's new passion project is the maze she's building on her Bedford farm; she shares her plans and inspiration for the project and teaches the proper measuring, staking and fertilizing techniques to properly plant successful trees.
programme.sub-title: Martha's Amazing Maze and How to Grow Trees From Seedlings

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha shows how to properly move an established tree on her very own Christmas tree farm; she gives a tour of her pinetum where she teaches about new and unusual conifer trees.
programme.sub-title: Everything You Need To Know About Conifers

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha brings the outdoors inside the home and shares her love of houseplants; she shows how to take care of the most popular houseplants and how to propagate them to create new plants.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha explores how to care for succulents including watering, fertilizing, and repotting.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha takes us inside her vegetable greenhouse to see how she has turned her harvest into a year-round bounty; she collects, stores, and sows seeds, and makes her perfect green drink.
programme.sub-title: Inside Martha's Vegetable Greenhouse; Seed Starting

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Restaurant owners Angie Rito and Scott Tacinelli join Martha in making their rolled lasagna with San Marzano tomato sauce, Italian bolognese, and chrysanthemum Caesar salad.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha, Monica Tran Carden, and Andrew Yu make homemade dumplings; Martha and Monica hand-make wontons and pork dumplings; Andrew and Martha prepare jade dumplings and pork and shrimp dumplings.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha samples bagel toppings and is joined by Gary Greengrass, owner of Barney Greengrass, an NYC staple; at PopUp Bagels, Martha makes bagels and constructs breakfast sandwiches with Adam Goldberg.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha makes the classic meringue cake from Casa Cipriani with pastry chef Alessia Tomassetti; Martha and bakery owner Lucie Franc De Ferriere bake a pear raspberry cake with jam and maple buttercream.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha and Chef Daniel Humm make redefined vegan dishes; Martha and Chef Daniel make a refreshing cocktail and gazpacho, followed by mushroom and seaweed baked rice and a rhubarb cobbler for dessert.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha and Chef Costas Spiliadis of Estiatorio Milos make Taramosalata and salad; they build an eggplant and zucchini tower with tzatziki; then, they salt-bake a fish served with yogurt.

programme.title: Essence of Emeril
programme.desc: Avocado soup; baked eggs and avocados; grapefruit and avocados; avocado stuffed with chicken salad.

programme.title: Essence of Emeril
programme.desc: Roux; rabbit and wild mushroom gumbo; seafood gumbo.

programme.title: Essence of Emeril
programme.desc: Mushroom and ham kabobs with rosemary aioli; portobello kabob; andouille and chicken kabobs with creole mustard; grilled shrimp kabobs with jalapeno butter.

programme.title: Emeril Live
programme.desc: Dandelion and bitter greens with warm bacon dressing; Pennsylvania Dutch corn chowder; ham and apple dump.

programme.title: Emeril Live
programme.desc: Mussel soup; coquilles St. Jacques; stuffed devil crabs; linguine with clam sauce.

programme.title: Emeril Live
programme.desc: Vermicelli with citrus cream sauce and radicchio; fettucine pieces with zucchini and clams; wild mushroom bolognese; super stuffed shells.

programme.title: Emeril Live
programme.desc: Pomegranate mojito with vanilla sugar; sugar-cured gravlax; seared shrimp salad with Thai palm sugar dressing; apple coffee cake; gingerbread with spiced crème anglaise.

programme.title: Emeril Live
programme.desc: Caribbean cocktail; Caribbean cracked conch; jerked leg of goat; yellow rice; coconut mango bread pudding with caramel rum sauce and fried coconut strips.

programme.title: Emeril Live
programme.desc: Passionfruit margarita; Florida grouper with tomatillo sauce; Florida orange-mango salsa; lump crabmeat guacamole with fried yucca chips.

programme.title: Emeril Live
programme.desc: Thai iced tea; shrimp coconut soup; crispy catfish curry; sticky rice with coconut sauce.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Emeril shares some basic cooking school lessons. Whether you're a beginner or advanced, you'll enjoy these recipes. A warm, inviting vegetable soup; roast chicken served with an assortment of roasted root vegetables.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Chicken and smoked sausage gumbo, plus tips on how to make a roux.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Emeril shares some sports party favorites: a juicy french dip sandwich; delicious tuna poke chips; the ultimate cheese dip: cheesy beer.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Coq Au Vin Blanc and an appetizing leek and bacon quiche.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Short Ribs braised with coffee and ancho chiles served with creamy parmesan polenta.
programme.sub-title: Coffee: Sneaky Flavor Enhancer in Savory Dishes

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Basic dough and versatile sauces.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Portuguese style grilled sardines.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Creamy turnip and parsnip soup.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Affordable French cuisine.

programme.title: Emeril Cooks
programme.desc: Emeril shares the most popular dishes at his namesake restaurant, a New Orleans staple for over 30 years.

programme.title: Emeril Cooks
programme.desc: New Orleans Saints tight-end Juwan Johnson and his wife, Chanen, join Emeril in the kitchen and cook up a tasty meal for their large and loyal group of followers on TikTok.

programme.title: Emeril Cooks
programme.desc: Asia Magee and Chassidy Carter of Café Reconcile, a non-profit that helps young people break into the food business, join Emeril to explore a menu inspired by their dishes.

programme.title: Emeril Cooks
programme.desc: Janie Glade inspires a delicious and economical meal.

programme.title: Emeril Cooks
programme.desc: Joined by the owner of Singleton's Mini Mart, Bau Nguyen, Emeril draws inspiration from Vietnamese cuisine to create Viet-style curried shrimp with cellophane noodles and slow-cooked beef brisket pho.

programme.title: Emeril Cooks
programme.desc: Joined by jazz legend Kermit Ruffins, Emeril makes red bean soup with cornbread croutons, and shrimp stuffed mirlitons with vodka sauce.

programme.title: Emeril Live
programme.desc: Pastry-wrapped baked brie with truffled crabmeat filling; warm manchego cheese salad; Emeril's kicked-up pasta with four cheeses; blue cheese-pear ice cream.

programme.title: Emeril Live
programme.desc: Baby back ribs; beef ribs; stuffed pork crown roast.

programme.title: Kimagure Orange Road: I Want to Return to That Day
programme.desc: As college nears, Kyosuke and Madoka finally end up revealing their feelings to eachother, but how will Hikaru react when she's told, and can things between the three of them ever be the same?

programme.title: The Professional Golgo 13
programme.desc: After killing the son of a powerful oil tycoon, an infamous hit-man is targeted by American governmental forces and superhuman assassins.

programme.title: The House Of The Lost On The Cape [English-Language Version]
programme.desc: A strange old woman allows a teenage runaway and a young orphan to stay in an abandoned house overlooking the sea. However, when a menacing entity threatens their new home, they must band together and face their fears to save it.

programme.title: Sound! Euphonium: The Movie – Our Promise: A Brand New Day
programme.desc: Kumiko is now in her second year at Kitauji High School, and with a new year comes new problems. As if making it to Nationals wasn't hard enough, Kumiko is tasked with mentoring the concert band's troublesome first years. [Subtitled]

programme.title: In This Corner Of The World [English-Language Version]
programme.desc: A spirited 18-year-old woman is married off to a man she barely knows and must soon adjust to the struggles of living in Hiroshima during World War II.

programme.title: Giovanni's Island [English-Language Version]
programme.desc: A dramatic yet heart-warming story of cross-cultural friendship among children in the aftermath of WWII, presented by Tokyo-based award-winning animation studio Production I.G. Based on true events.

programme.title: Project A-Ko
programme.desc: Superhuman high schooler, A-ko, must set aside her rivalry with her genius classmate, B-ko, to save earth from evil alien invaders.

programme.title: Project A-Ko 2: Plot of the Daitokuji Financial Group
programme.desc: Three weeks after the alien ship landing on Graviton City, A-ko and the gang go on summer vacation. Meanwhile, chaos breaks out when B-ko's father arms the local military with new mecha to attack the alien ship.

programme.title: Project A-Ko 3: Cinderella Rhapsody
programme.desc: While working part-time at a fast food joint, A-ko falls for the mysterious Kei. While B-ko happens to like him as well, both of them are unaware that C-ko is the apple of Kei's eyes.

programme.title: Back In The Day
programme.desc: A young boxer is taken under the wing of a mob boss after his Mother dies and his Father is run out of town for being an abusive alcoholic.

programme.title: Colette
programme.desc: Colette is pushed by her husband to write novels under his name. Upon their success, she fights to make her talents known, challenging gender norms.

programme.title: Before We Go
programme.desc: Two strangers stuck in Manhattan for the night grow into each other's most trusted confidants when an evening of unexpected adventure forces them to confront their fears and take control of their lives.

programme.title: Whiplash
programme.desc: In this triple Oscar-winning film, a young drummer (Miles Teller) in his school's top-tier jazz band clashes with the intense, abusive methods of an obsessive music teacher (J.K. Simmons). With Melissa Benoist.

programme.title: The Nest
programme.desc: Life for an entrepreneur and his American family begin to take a twisted turn after moving into an English country manor.

programme.title: Locke
programme.desc: Ivan Locke, a dedicated family man and successful construction manager, receives a phone call on the eve of the biggest challenge of his career that sets in motion a series of events that threaten his carefully cultivated existence.

programme.title: LYING AND STEALING
programme.desc: Ivan is a gifted and discerning art thief who wants out. Elyse is an aspiring actress whose own past transgressions in Hollywood haunt her, as well as a mountain of debt. These two outsiders are drawn to each other.

programme.title: Two For The Money
programme.desc: After suffering a career-ending knee injury, a former college football star aligns himself with one of the most renowned touts in the sports-gambling business.

programme.title: Robert the Bruce
programme.desc: Injured and on the run, an outlaw king sets out to win Scotland’s long awaited freedom from England and reclaim his throne.

programme.title: Fortress
programme.desc: A group of criminals hellbent on revenge forces a retired officer and his son to save the day.

programme.title: Sniper's eye: Fortress
programme.desc: After retired CIA agent Robert Carter Michaels (Bruce Willis) and his son Paul (Jesse Metcalfe) defended the highly secured secret base ‘The Fortress’ against elite criminal Frederic Balzary (Chad Michael Murray), they are thrust back into action.

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: A dramatization of the April 2010 disaster, when an oil well called Deepwater Horizon exploded causing the worst spill in US history.

programme.title: DRAGGED ACROSS CONCRETE
programme.desc: Police partners descend into the criminal underworld after they are suspended for assaulting a suspect on video.

programme.title: Kicking & Screaming
programme.desc:
After college graduation, Grover moves in with several friends and loses his girlfriend to a fellowship in Prague. Reluctant to step into adulthood, Grover and his friends wrestle with leaving the past behind.
Rated R

programme.title: The Wendell Baker Story
programme.desc: Luke Wilson plays a good-hearted ex-con who gets a job in a retirement hotel. Three elderly residents help him win back his girlfriend as he lends them a hand in fighting hotel corruption.

programme.title: My Blind Brother
programme.desc: A slacker (Nick Kroll) and his blind athlete brother (Adam Scott) compete for the love of the same woman (Jenny Slate) in this hilarious comedy.

programme.title: Second Act
programme.desc: Maya, a lady with little educational qualification but abundance of street smarts, lands a job in a corporate firm when a friend creates a fake profile for her. She must now live the lie convincingly.

programme.title: The Wendell Baker Story
programme.desc: Luke Wilson plays a good-hearted ex-con who gets a job in a retirement hotel. Three elderly residents help him win back his girlfriend as he lends them a hand in fighting hotel corruption.

programme.title: The Wendell Baker Story
programme.desc: Luke Wilson plays a good-hearted ex-con who gets a job in a retirement hotel. Three elderly residents help him win back his girlfriend as he lends them a hand in fighting hotel corruption.

programme.title: Are You Here
programme.desc: Two childhood best friends embark on a road trip back to their hometown after one of them learns he has inherited a large sum of money from his recently deceased estranged father.

programme.title: The Oath
programme.desc: A controversial White House policy turns family member against family member when Chris, a high-strung progressive news junkie, and his more levelheaded wife Kai learn that citizens are being asked to sign a loyalty oath to the President.

programme.title: June In January
programme.desc: Wealthy Alex and blue-collar June are madly in love but get their wires crossed while racing down the aisle. June's been preparing for a very specific kind of wedding her whole life.

programme.title: Amazing Winter Romance
programme.desc: When journalist Julia goes back home to find inspiration, she discovers her childhood friend has built a giant snow maze which prompts her to find her way to true love.

programme.title: Campfire Kiss
programme.desc: Feeling disconnected with her teenage son, a protective mother decides to step outside of her comfort zone and take him camping. But as soon as she arrives, she begins butting heads with her handsome cabin neighbor.

programme.title: Marry Me in Yosemite
programme.desc: Zoe, a notable photojournalist, visits Yosemite landscapes made famous by Ansel Adams. When she meets Jack, an intriguing tour guide, he opens her eyes to new adventures as they embark on a journey.

programme.title: The Love Club: Nicole
programme.desc: Freshly engaged interior designer, Nicole, still wonders if the one she is meant to be with is her mystery college pen pal whose letters she has kept all these years.

programme.title: A Picture of Her
programme.desc: Beth unwittingly becomes the subject of an award-winning magazine’s cover and goes on a quest to uncover the true identity of the mystery photographer who snapped her photo.

programme.title: Stop the Wedding
programme.desc: A career-focused San Francisco divorce attorney whose busy professional life has replaced her desire for romance. When she learns that her widowed Aunt has hastily agreed to marry a charming veteran movie star.

programme.title: Make Me A Match
programme.desc: Vivi enlists the help of an Indian Matchmaker, Raina, to change her fate in love. However, Raina's son Bhumesh just might be the change Vivi needed all along.

programme.title: Walking The Dog
programme.desc: Rival lawyers battle each other in court as their respective dogs fall madly in love, bringing their guardians together at every turn until they reluctantly realize it may not just be the pups who are each other's true Valentine.

programme.title: Lead With Your Heart
programme.desc: After forgetting his wedding anniversary, Ben Walker scrambles to make a dinner reservation and buy a gift for his wife, Maura. When Ben calls Maura to tell her about the reservation she realizes that she forgot.

programme.title: Love in Glacier National: A National Park Romance
programme.desc: An avalanche forecasting expert brings her new technology to Glacier National Park where she faces push-back from the Director of Mountain Rescue who's trained in intuition and common sense.

programme.title: Cranberry Christmas
programme.desc: A separated couple feign marital bliss on national television to help their town's Christmas festival - and their business. But what will be when rekindled love is complicated by new opportunities?

programme.title: Ghosts of Christmas Past
programme.desc: Ellie is told by a fortune teller that she must resolve her past and make amends with all of those she ghosted before Christmas and discovers love in the process.

programme.title: Our Christmas Journey
programme.desc: As a single mom and her teenage son with autism come to a crossroad during Christmas, she must learn to let go so he can flourish as she finds her own heart healing in unexpected ways.

programme.title: Christmas Scavenger Hunt
programme.desc: When Belinda heads back to her hometown for the holidays, things get complicated when she is forced to team up with her ex, Dustin, at the town's annual Christmas scavenger hunt.

programme.title: A Christmas Treasure
programme.desc: After opening a 100-year-old time capsule and meeting a charming chef, Lou questions whether or not she should move to New York after Christmas and further her writing career.

programme.title: All Saints Christmas
programme.desc: Lisette is a popular R&B singer who’s getting ready to travel home to New Orleans for Christmas.

programme.title: Marrying Father Christmas
programme.desc: When Miranda Chester set off to find information on her biological father two Christmases ago, she never imagined that her investigation would lead her to the family she had always longed for and the love of her life.

programme.title: Christmas Class Reunion
programme.desc: Valedictorian Elle is determined to host a perfect 15-year high school reunion. She's looking forward to seeing her high school crush Kam, but she finds unexpected support in bad boy Devin.

programme.title: Must Love Christmas
programme.desc: Known for her Christmas-themed stories, a renowned romance novelist finds herself snowbound in the charming town of Cranberry Falls. She soon finds herself in an unexpected love triangle with her childhood crush and a determined reporter.

programme.title: A Royal Corgi Christmas
programme.desc: Prince Edmond hopes to win his mother's love back with the gift of an adorable but unruly corgi. He hires American dog trainer Cecily to make the corgi presentable for the annual Christmas ball.

programme.title: Nine Lives of Christmas
programme.desc: After a stray cat adopts Zachary, he meets Marliee and realizes the single life is not as fulfilling as he thought it was.

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: World revolutionaries are quizzed about football scores; figures from works of art go on strike throughout galleries in England; the search continues for a cure for over-acting; Viking marauders kidnap Englishmen who ask for canned ham.

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: Miners brawl over historical facts; hospital patients serve the doctors; five shipwrecked mariners decide whom they will have for dinner.

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: A courteous murderer wins a suspended sentence by virtue of his charm; a search for Paris by way of Iceland is interrupted by a plane crash and a shipwreck. Also: how to dispose of pets before going on vacation.

programme.title: Monty Python's Life of Brian
programme.desc: A notorious religious satire, the film tells the story of Brian (Graham Chapman), a reluctant would-be messiah who rises to prominence as a result of a series of absurd and truly hilarious circumstances.

programme.desc: The very best of Terry Gilliam's Monty Python performances and sketches.

programme.desc: A dissatisfied bridegroom tries to exchange his spouse; hunters pursue a terrifying mosquito; domestic problems interrupt the work of Beethoven, Shakespeare, Michelangelo and other creative geniuses.

programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Rob, Sterling, and Chanel find out why "White Men Can't Dread," witness the winged lawbreakers of "Bird Crimes," and take it to the next level with "Extremer Sports."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, professional basketball star Nate Robinson takes a look at some fellow "Sharpshooters," plays some "Supermarket Sports," and joins the celebration with "Dunk Cam."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, world-famous interviewer Larry King asks Rob some "Great Questions," gets "Flash Frozen," and shows the world why he's "So Sexy It Hurts."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, pro-skater Paul Rodriguez and Rob break down karate style in "Enter The Donkey," laugh at some "Funny Dads," and reveal the painful side of being "Bad At Ledges."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, model Chanel Iman learns the dangers of being "Too Sexy to Walk," how to avoid getting a "Blackout Makeover" and the embarrassment of finding yourself suddenly "Chanaked."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Grammy-winning singer/songwriter Ne-Yo avoids some "Ambush Assassins" while getting busy with "Sexy Love" and breaks new ground with "The Future Of Music.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Rob, Sterling, and Chanel learn how people can be protected by "Angel Bubbles", witness an international "Animal Uprising", and celebrate some "Gifts From Heaven."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Rob shows skateboard prodigy Jagger Eaton some "Mega Dumps", discovers some "Magnet Feet", and they all learn how to build "Budget Skateparks".

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Sleepy Hollow's resident badass Lyndie Greenwood joins Rob, Sterling and Chanel to check out some terrifying "Everyday Demons" & laugh at some hilarious hockey "Puck Ups".

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Hollywood stunt driver, Top Gear USA host, and X-Games champion Tanner Foust shares the dangers of "Going Extra, Extra Big, and test drives some "Next Level Rides".

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, rapper YG drops by the studio to explore a new meaning of his hit song "My Hitta", uncover the true meaning of "Rollin' Fatties".

programme.title: Ridiculousness

programme.title: The Fifth Estate
programme.desc: The top-notch team of hosts Bob McKeown, Gillian Findlay, Mark Kelley and Habiba Nosheen provides unique and engaging documentaries from Canada and beyond. "The Fifth Estate" is a reference to the term Fourth Estate, and was chosen to highlight the program's determination to go beyond everyday news into original journalism. The series has won numerous awards for its reporting, including Gemini Awards, International Emmys, the Michener Award, and even an Academy Award for a 1981 episode that was released in theaters the following year. Since September 1975, Canadians have tuned in to experience interesting stories that are always well-crafted and thought-provoking.

programme.title: Cross Canada Road Trip
programme.desc: A tour around the country exploring diverse stories through art, culture and food.

programme.title: O Canada
programme.desc: A CBC News special celebrating Canada and its unique stories.

programme.title: Marketplace
programme.desc: Canada's consumer watchdog series since 1972, this news program uncovers wrongdoings in the marketplace. With the help of hidden cameras, correspondents dish out the dirt on not so "clean" business practices. Once they get the evidence they need on tape, they apply pressure on businesses to change policies vis-a-vis the products and services they provide to the public.
